Hi, I'm Peter.

I am a developer working with data intelligence at Brilliant in Trondheim, Norway. Recently I finished my master theisis in Master of Science in Electronic Systems Design within signal processing and communication. In my spare time I'm a tinkerer, playing with home automation and you bet I always have a project going.

If you want to check out more of my work and follow along more closely, check out my socials as I post more regularly there.

Some of my work

ESPHome-AUXswitcher

A box that automates the switching between PC speakers and headphones.

ESPHome Desk Controller

Simple desk controller for controlling volume of a media player and four buttons used for anything.

ESPHome Solder Station

A simple soldering station made smart, so that when you lift the soldering iron off its dock, it turns on and the solder fan and light comes on.

ESPHome Video Doorbell

A cheap video doorbell for Home Assistant with a 3D printed casing to monitor our front door when we have guests coming over.

Grow-Rack

A simple shelf for plants with grow light LEDs.

Toilet Paper Roll Counter Box

A box which can keep track of your toilet paper rolls

XBar HA Fetch

A xbar plugin that can show you sensor state from Home Assistant.

Smart Table Fan

A cheap table fan that can be fully automated for warm summer days.

XBar Omega Verksted door status

A xbar plugin that can show you sensor state from Home Assistant.

NTNU related

Elektronikk- & Teknologidagen 2019

Elektronikk- & Teknologidagen is a yearly career fair organized by the electronic engineering students. In 2019 I was leading the division for company recruiting. We delivered a substantial growth, with a 30% income increase compared to years before us. This made the following excursion to Asia practically free for the students. I also made the aftermovie which you can see here.

TFE4580 Project thesis

The fall of 2020 I wrote a project thesis, where I took a deeper look into realism in AR and tried to figure out what the level of occlusion had to say for the Quality of Experience of the user in an augmented reality system

Vevcom

I volunteered in the comite in charge of the website of Sct. Omega Broderskap, the union associated with my studies. During my time being there, we launched a completely rewritten and modern website. The first year I was in charge of communication within and without the comitee, and the following year I came the leader of design.

Honourable Mentions

Norbit Sonar Test Tank

Main super star in Norbit Subsea's test tank facility video from my time working there

My Favorite Open Source Projects

ESPHome

Easiest way to make whatever you want for Home Assistant.

Home Assistant

In my opinion the best home automation software available

WLED

Great software for controlling LED strips (SK6812 preferably).

xbar

xbar (the BitBar reboot) lets you put the output from any script/program in your macOS menu bar.
